meta.name: description
meta.content: Horry County Schools located in Myrtle Beach South Carolina is made up of 56 schools within nine attendance areas: Aynor, Carolina Forest, Conway, Green Sea Floyds, Loris. Contact Us at 843-488-6772.
Horry County Schools located in Myrtle Beach South Carolina is made up of 56 schools within nine attendance areas: Aynor, Carolina Forest, Conway, Green Sea Floyds, Loris. Contact Us at 843-488-6772.

img.alt: HCS 2020 Prom Information

div.p: Due to the latest information from the Governor’s office regarding school closures through April 2020, all HCS proms and galas will be postponed.

a.title: Go to comments for HCS 2020 Prom Information

img.alt: Alternate (eLearning) Instructional Plan

div.p: View the Alternate (eLearning) Instructional Plan.

a.title: Go to comments for Alternate (eLearning) Instructional Plan

img.alt: Grab-and-Go Meals for students

div.p: HCS is offering student meal delivery options in addition to 13 pick-up locations during the extended school closure Monday through Friday.

a.title: Go to comments for Grab-and-Go Meals for students

img.alt: COVID-19 Updates

div.p: Get the latest information about student learning at home, food service opportunities at schools, and more.

a.title: Go to comments for COVID-19 Updates

img.alt: NOTICE OF CANCELLATION - HCS Board Meeting - March 30, 2020

a.span: NOTICE OF CANCELLATION - HCS Board Meeting - March 30, 2020

div.p: The Horry County Board of Education board and committee meetings originally scheduled for March 30, 2020, have been cancelled.

a.title: Go to comments for NOTICE OF CANCELLATION - HCS Board Meeting - March 30, 2020

img.alt: Finalists named for HCS Rookie Teacher of the Year

a.span: Finalists named for HCS Rookie Teacher of the Year

div.p: Horry County Schools is one step closer in determining the district winner in its inaugural Rookie Teacher of the Year program.

a.title: Go to comments for Finalists named for HCS Rookie Teacher of the Year

img.alt: Quigley wins prestigious Mentoring Award from the South Carolina Council for Exceptional Children

a.span: Quigley wins prestigious Mentoring Award from the South Carolina Council for Exceptional Children

div.p: Janet Quigley, has won the 2019-2020 SC Teacher Education Division Mentoring Award.

a.title: Go to comments for Quigley wins prestigious Mentoring Award from the South Carolina Council for Exceptional Children

img.alt: Socastee High’s Eva Gaddy earns national honors from the College Board

a.span: Socastee High’s Eva Gaddy earns national honors from the College Board

div.p: The College Board has chosen Eva Gaddy for the 2019-20 College Board Counselor Recognition Program.

a.title: Go to comments for Socastee High’s Eva Gaddy earns national honors from the College Board

img.alt: HCS announces the top five finalists for Teacher of the Year!

a.span: HCS announces the top five finalists for Teacher of the Year!

div.p: A list of ten was narrowed to five when Horry County Schools named the finalists.

a.title: Go to comments for HCS announces the top five finalists for Teacher of the Year!

img.alt: Horry County Board of Education Member Janet P. Graham was recognized at the South Carolina School Boards Association 2020 Annual Convention

a.span: Horry County Board of Education Member Janet P. Graham was recognized at the South Carolina School Boards Association 2020 Annual Convention

a.title: Go to comments for Horry County Board of Education Member Janet P. Graham was recognized at the South Carolina School Boards Association 2020 Annual Convention

img.alt: HCS receives Meritorious Budget Award for effective fiscal management

a.span: HCS receives Meritorious Budget Award for effective fiscal management

div.p: The Association of School Business Officials International (ASBO) presented Horry County Schools with the Meritorious Budget Award.

a.title: Go to comments for HCS receives Meritorious Budget Award for effective fiscal management

img.alt: All twelve HCS National Merit Semifinalists named Finalists

a.span: All twelve HCS National Merit Semifinalists named Finalists

div.p: Twelve Horry County Schools students are one step closer to becoming National Merit Scholars.

a.title: Go to comments for All twelve HCS National Merit Semifinalists named Finalists

img.alt: Ayers wins SCCTE Literacy Champion Award

a.span: Ayers wins SCCTE Literacy Champion Award

div.p: Gretchen Ayers, a learning specialist for middle school English Language Arts (ELA), received the 2020 Literacy Champion Award.

a.title: Go to comments for Ayers wins SCCTE Literacy Champion Award

img.alt: HCS Innovators of the Month

div.p: See how our teachers and staff are Inspiring Possibilities using technology in the classroom at HCS.

a.title: Go to comments for HCS Innovators of the Month

img.alt: Socastee High wins third Academic Olympics championship

a.span: Socastee High wins third Academic Olympics championship

div.p: Socastee High School’s Academic Team won its third consecutive championship in Horry County Schools’ Academic Olympics

a.title: Go to comments for Socastee High wins third Academic Olympics championship

span.p: Enjoy this message from Dr. Rick Maxey, HCS Superintendent.

a.title: Edit your account settings.
Sign out of my website.

img.alt: Horry County Schools
Horry County Schools

div.p: Horry County Schools vision is to be a premier, world-class school system in which every student acquires an excellent education. Our schools will be welcoming centers organized around high-quality teaching and learning.

Horry County Schools does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, disability, age, immigrant status, English-speaking status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal or S.C. law in its programs or activities. For questions regarding the nondiscrimination policies call 843-488-6700, or write Horry County Schools, 335 Four Mile Rd., Conway, SC 29526.
